column2: et invocāte nōmen ejus; adnuntiāte inter gentēs opera ejus. ^ Give glory to the Lord
column3: and call upon his name; declare his works among the Gentiles.

column2: et psallite eī; narrāte omnia mīrābilia ejus. ^ Sing to him
column3: yea sing praises to him; relate all his wondrous works.

column1: 3 ^ Laudāminī in nōmine sanctō ejus; laetētur cor quaerentium Dominum. ^ Glory ye in his holy name; let the heart of them rejoice that seek the Lord.

column2: et confirmāminī; quaerite faciem ejus semper. ^ Seek ye the Lord
column3: and be strengthened; seek his face evermore.

column1: 5 ^ Mementōte mīrābilium ejus quae fēcit; prōdigia ejus
column2: et jūdicia ōris ejus. ^ Remember his marvellous works which he hath done; his wonders
column3: and the judgments of his mouth.

column2: servī ejus; fīliī Jācōbis
column3: ēlectī ejus. ^ O ye seed of Abraham
column4: his servant; ye sons of Jacob

column1: 7 ^ Ipse Dominus Deus noster; in ūniversā terrā jūdicia ejus. ^ He is the Lord our God; his judgments are in all the earth.
8 ^ Memor fuit in saeculum testāmentī suī; verbī quod mandāvit in mille generātiōnēs
column2: ^ He hath remembered his covenant for ever; the word which he commanded to a thousand generations
et jūrāmentī suī ad Isaac. ^ which he made to Abraham
column3: and his oath to Isaac.

column1: 10 ^ Et statuit illud Jācōbī in praeceptum
column2: et Isrāēlī in testāmentum aeternum
column3: ^ And he appointed the same to Jacob for a law
column4: and to Israel for an everlasting testament

column2: fūniculum hērēditātis vestrae. ^ saying: To thee will I give the land of Chanaan
column3: the lot of your inheritance.

column2: paucissimī
column3: et incolae ejus
column4: ^ When they were but a small number

column1: 13 ^ et pertransīvērunt dē gente in gentem
column2: et dē regnō ad populum alterum. ^ and they passed from nation to nation
column3: and from one kingdom to another people.

column2: et corripuit prō eīs rēgēs. ^ He suffered no man to hurt them
column3: and he reproved kings for their sakes.

column2: et in profētīs meīs nōlīte malignārī. ^ Touch ye not my anointed
column3: and do no evil to my prophets.

column2: et omne firmāmentum pānis contrīvit. ^ And he called a famine upon the land
column3: and he broke in pieces all the support of bread.

column1: 17 ^ Mīsit ante eōs virum; in servum venundātus est Jōsēf. ^ He sent a man before them; Joseph
column2: who was sold for a slave.
ferrum pertransīvit animam ejus
column3: ^ They humbled his feet in fetters; the iron pierced his soul

column1: 19 ^ dōnec venīret verbum ejus; ēloquium Dominī inflammāvit eum. ^ until his word came; the word of the Lord inflamed him.

column2: princeps populōrum
column3: et dīmīsit eum. ^ The king sent and released him
column5: and he set him at liberty.

column2: et principem omnis possessiōnis suae
column3: ^ He made him master of his house
column4: and ruler of all his possession

column1: 22 ^ ut ērudīret principēs ejus sīcut sēmet ipsum
column2: et senēs ejus prūdentiam docēret. ^ that he might instruct his princes as himself
column3: and teach his ancients wisdom.

column2: et Jācōb accola fuit in terrā Chām. ^ And Israel went into Egypt
column3: and Jacob was a sojourner in the land of Cham.

column2: et firmāvit eum super inimīcōs ejus. ^ And he increased his people exceedingly
column3: and strengthened them over their enemies.

column1: 25 ^ Convertit cor eōrum ut odīrent populum ejus
column2: et dolum facerent in servōs ejus. ^ He turned their heart to hate his people
column3: and to deal deceitfully with his servants.

column2: quem ēlēgit ipsum. ^ He sent Moses his servant; Aaron the man whom he had chosen.

column1: 27 ^ Posuit in eīs verba signōrum suōrum
column2: et prōdigiōrum in terrā Chām. ^ He gave them power to show them signs
column3: and his wonders in the land of Cham.

column2: et obscūrāvit
column3: et nōn exacerbāvit sermōnēs suōs. ^ He sent darkness

column2: et occīdit piscēs eōrum. ^ He turned their waters into blood
column3: and destroyed their fish.

column1: 30 ^ Ēdidit terra eōrum rānās in  penetrālibus rēgum ipsōrum. ^ Their land brought forth frogs
column2: in the inner chambers of their kings.
et vēnit cinomia et cinifēs in omnibus fīnibus eōrum. ^ He spoke
column3: and there came divers sorts of flies and sciniphs in all their coasts.

column1: 32 ^ Posuit pluviās eōrum grandinem; ignem combūrentem in terrā ipsōrum. ^ He gave them hail for rain; a burning fire in the land.
33 ^ Et percussit vīneās eōrum et fīculneās eōrum
column2: et contrīvit lignum fīnium eōrum. ^ And he destroyed their vineyards and their fig trees
column3: and he broke in pieces the trees of their coasts.

column2: et vēnit locusta
column3: et brūchus cujus nōn erat numerus; ^ He spoke
column5: and the bruchus of which there was no number;

column1: 35 ^ et comēdit omne foenum in terrā eōrum
column2: et comēdit omnem frūctum terrae eōrum. ^ and they devoured all the grass in their land
column3: and consumed all the fruit of their ground.

column1: 36 ^ Et percussit omne prīmōgenitum in terrā eōrum; prīmitiās omnis labōris eōrum. ^ And he slew all the firstborn in their land; the firstfruits of all their labour.
37 ^ Et ēdūxit eōs cum argentō et aurō
column2: et nōn erat in tribubus eōrum infirmus. ^ And he brought them out with silver and gold
column3: and there was not among their tribes one that was feeble.

column1: 38 ^ Laetāta est Aegiptus in profectiōne eōrum
column2: quia incubuit timor eōrum super eōs. ^ Egypt was glad when they departed
column3: for the fear of them lay upon them.

column2: et ignem ut lūcēret eīs per noctem. ^ He spread a cloud for their protection
column3: and fire to give them light in the night.

column2: et vēnit coturnīx
column3: et pāne caelī saturāvit eōs. ^ They asked
column5: and he filled them with the bread of heaven.

column2: et flūxērunt aquae; abīvērunt in siccō flūmina; ^ He opened the rock
column3: and waters flowed; rivers ran down in the dry land.

column1: 42 ^ Quoniam memor fuit verbī sanctī suī
column2: quod habuit ad Ābrahām puerum suum. ^ Because he remembered his holy word
column3: which he had spoken to his servant Abraham.

column1: 43 ^ Et ēdūxit populum suum in exsultātiōne
column2: et ēlectōs suōs in laetitiā. ^ And he brought forth his people with joy
column3: and his chosen with gladness.

column2: et labōrēs populōrum possēdērunt; ^ And he gave them the lands of the Gentiles
column3: and they possessed the labours of the people;

column2: et lēgem ejus requīrant. ^ that they might observe his justifications
column3: and seek after his law.
